sen.j: 平 知宗（たいら の ともむね、寿永3年（1184年） - 建長7年7月5日 (旧暦)（1255年8月8日））は鎌倉時代の平家の落人。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tomomune (1184- August 8, 1255) was a defeated soldier of the Taira clan in the Kamakura period.
TAIRA no Tomomune (1184- August 15, 1255) was a defeated soldier of the Taira family in the Kamakura period.

sen.e: TAIRA no Tomomune (1184- August 15, 1255) was a defeated soldier of the Taira family in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 桓武平氏の平知盛の三男。
sen.e: He was the third child of Kanmu-Heishi TAIRA no Tomomori.
He was the third son of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Tomomori.
sen.cmt: child→son としました。(Taira clan) を追加しました（用語統一 2009/7/9 指示を応用）。
sen.e: He was the third son of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Tomomori.
His brothers were TAIRA no Tomoakira and TAIRA no Tomotada.
His brothers were TAIRA no Tomoakira and TAIRA no Tomotada.
His brothers were TAIRA no Tomoakira and TAIRA no Tomotada.

sen.j: 子に宗重尚、宗助国がある。
sen.e: His children were Shigehisa SO and Sukekuni SO.
His children included Shigehisa SO and Sukekuni SO.
His children included Shigehisa SO and Sukekuni SO.

sen.j: 幼名は鬼王丸で、別名は貞重、盛重。
sen.e: His childhood name was Kiomaru, and his common names were Sadashige and Morishige.
His childhood name was Kiomaru, and other names were Sadashige and Morishige.
sen.cmt: 原文には「通称」とありましが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「別名」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので原文を修正し、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: His childhood name was Kiomaru, and other names were Sadashige and Morishige.

sen.j: 通称は武藤武者、武藤右馬助、惟宗判官。
sen.e: Tomomune was commonly known as MUTO Musha (warrior), MUTO Umanosuke (deputy minister of the institution for horse care), and KOREMUNE hangan (judge).
Tomomune was commonly known as Muto Musha (warrior), Muto Umanosuke (deputy minister of the institution for horse care), and Koremune hangan (judge).
sen.cmt: 訳文で「武者」「右馬助」「判官」は姓名の「名」としては扱われていないため、「武藤」「惟宗」は頭文字のみ大文字としました。
sen.e: Tomomune was commonly known as Muto Musha (warrior), Muto Umanosuke (deputy minister of the institution for horse care), and Koremune hangan (judge).

sen.j: 惟宗 知宗（これむね ともむね）や宗 知宗（そう ともむね）、武藤 知宗（むとう ともむね）とも名乗っている。
sen.e: He also called himself Tomomune KOREMUNE, Tomomune SO, and Tomomune MUTO.
He also called himself Tomomune KOREMUNE, Tomomune SO, and Tomomune MUTO.
He also called himself Tomomune KOREMUNE, Tomomune SO, and Tomomune MUTO.

sen.j: 寿永3年（1184年）、平家の都落ちで各地を転々としている時期に誕生。
sen.e: Tomomune was born in 1184 at the period when the Taira family moved from place to place after leaving the capital.
Tomomune was born in 1184 at the period when the Taira family moved from place to place after leaving the capital.
Tomomune was born in 1184 at the period when the Taira family moved from place to place after leaving the capital.

sen.j: 元暦2年（寿永4年/1185年）に壇ノ浦の戦いで平家が滅亡した後、長門国斎藤兵庫を経て鎮西奉行武藤資頼と乳母の惟宗氏によって庇護される。
sen.e: After the Taira family fell in the Battle of Dannoura in 1185, Tomomune was taken into the care of Chinzai Bugyo (magistrate of Kyusyu region) Sukeyori MUTO and the wet nurse Koremune clan through Hyogo SAITO in Nagato Province.

After the Taira family fell in the Battle of Dannoura in 1185, Tomomune was taken into the care of Chinzei Bugyo (magistrate of Kyusyu region) Sukeyori MUTO and the wet nurse Koremune clan through Hyogo SAITO in Nagato Province.

After the Taira family fell in the Battle of Dannoura in 1185, Tomomune was taken into the care of Chinzei Bugyo (magistrate of Kyusyu region) Sukeyori MUTO and the wet nurse Koremune clan through Hyogo SAITO in Nagato Province.

sen.j: その後、武藤資頼の養子になり、正治2年（1200年）に太宰府に任官する。
sen.e: Afterwards Tomomune was adopted as a son of Sukeyori MUTO, and in 1200 he was appointed to Dazaifu.
Afterwards Tomomune was adopted as a son of Sukeyori MUTO, and in 1200 he was appointed to Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 「大宰府」を補足しました（用語検索より）。
sen.e: Afterwards Tomomune became an adopted son of Sukeyori MUTO, and in 1200 he was appointed to Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region).

sen.j: 建長7年7月5日（1255年8月8日）、太宰府北殿で死去。
sen.e: In August 8, 1255 he passed away in Kita-dono Palace of Dazaifu.
In August 15, 1255 he passed away in Kita-dono Palace of Dazaifu.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換しました。
sen.e: In August 15, 1255 he passed away in Kita-dono Palace of Dazaifu.
His age at death was 72.
Died at the age of 72.
sen.cmt: 表記変更しました（用語統一）。
sen.e: Died at the age of 72.

sen.j: 死去した日については異説あり、建長7年7月3日 (旧暦)（1255年8月6日）とする説もある。
sen.e: According to a different opinion regarding the date of his death, it was August 6, 1255.
According to a different opinion regarding the date of his death, it was August 13, 1255.
